poem:
### Discovery

In quiet rooms lit by desire,  
She whispers secrets of longing,  
Unveils the art of touch—strange,  
Yet familiar—a dance of souls  
In the dim corridors of the heart,  
Where toys become signposts,  
Role play—maps to forgotten lands.  
Teaching is the new seduction;  
Her solitude—a fertile garden.  
Here, the flesh finds its voice.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "This is how we do it: ‘It’s been exciting to introduce him to toys, role play and unusual positions’ Annie, 36 There’s quite a seductive element of being a bit like a teacher I’ve always been pretty horny and have found it quite easy to connect with people on a sexual level. In general, if I’ve wanted to get laid, I’ve managed to do that quite easily. Because of that I’ve taken periods of celibacy in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
